qụóniam sperávi in te. ^ Preserve me: qụóniam bonórum meórum non eģes.~»^ I have said to the Lord
for thou hast no need of my goods."

1 ^ Consèrva me: 3 ^ Sanctîs qụi sunt in terra ejus
Dòmine: mirificávit òmnes voluntátes meas in eîs. ^ To the saints who are in his land
qụóniam sperávi in te. ^ Preserve me: he hath made wonderful all my desires in them.

1 ^ Consèrva me: 4 ^ Multiplicátaĕ sunt infirmitátes eórum~; póstea acceleravérunt. Non congregábo conventìcula eórum de sangụìnibus
Dòmine: nec mèmor èro nóminum eórum per lábia mea. ^ Their infirmities were multiplied~; afterwards they made haste. I will not gather together their meetings for bloodofferings
qụóniam sperávi in te. ^ Preserve me: nor will I be mindful of their names by my lips.

Dòmine: et cálicis mei~; tu es qụi restìtues hereditátem meam mìchi. ^ The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup~; it is thou that wilt restore my inheritance to me.

1 ^ Consèrva me: 6 ^ Funes caduérunt mìchi in praĕclárîs~; ètenim heréditas mea praĕclára est mìchi. ^ The lines are fallen unto me in goodly places~; for my inheritance is excellent to me.

7 ^ Benedícem Dòminum qụi tribúvit mìchi intelléctum~; ìnsuper et usqụe ad nòctem increpavérunt me renes mei. ^ I will bless the Lord who hath given me understanding~; moreover also my reins have corrected me even till night.
8 ^ Provedébam Dòminum in conspèctu meo sèmper
qụóniam sperávi in te. ^ Preserve me: ne commóvear. ^ I set the Lord always in my sight
O Lord: for he is at my right hand

1 ^ Consèrva me: 9 ^ Pròpter hoc laĕtátum est cor meum
Dòmine: et exsultávit lingụa mea~; ìnsuper et carnis mea reqụiéscet in spe. ^ On account of this my heart hath been glad
qụóniam sperávi in te. ^ Preserve me: and my tongue hath rejoiced~; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope.

1 ^ Consèrva me: 10 ^ Qụóniam non derelìnqụes ánimam meam in infèrno
Dòmine: nec dabis sanctum tuum vedére corrupțiónem. ^ Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell
qụóniam sperávi in te. ^ Preserve me: nor wilt thou give thy holy one to see corruption.

1 ^ Consèrva me: 11 ^ Notas mìchi fecìsti vias vitaĕ~; adimplébis me laĕtìția cum vùltu tuo~; delectațiónes in dèxtera tua usqụe in finem. ^ Thou hast made known to me the ways of life
Dòmine: thou shalt fill me with joy with thy countenance~; at thy right hand are delights even to the end.
